subject: Public Speaking
title: Dry Mouth and the Saliva Response
description: A micro-lesson that makes Dry Mouth and the Saliva Response usable.

hook.text: Mid-sentence, your mouth goes completely dry. Your tongue sticks to your palate. Every word becomes a struggle.

buildup.text: Fight-or-flight diverts energy from digestion. Saliva production drops because your body has other priorities.

discovery.text: Your sympathetic nervous system shuts down functions it considers non-essential in a threat. Digestion is first to go.

twist.text: Ancient lie detection used this. Suspects chewed dry rice ‚Äî if they couldn't swallow, they were considered guilty.

climax.text: Dry mouth is your body's way of saying: we have bigger problems than eating right now. Focus on survival.

punchline.text: Your body stops making saliva to fight a threat that doesn't exist.

quiz.question: Why does your mouth go dry during a speech?
options: Fight-or-flight response shuts down saliva production
